ARABIC: وَإِن يَرَوْا۟ ءَايَةً يُعْرِضُوا۟ وَيَقُولُوا۟ سِحْرٌ مُّسْتَمِرٌّ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: If they see a Sign they turn away, saying There is no end to this witchcraft!'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: But if they see a sign they turn away, and say: "This is the same old lie continuing,"
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: (Regardless of any Signs these people see), they turn away and say: “This is an ongoing sorcery.”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: Whenever they see a miracle, they turn away from it and say, "This is just a powerful magic".
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: And when they see a sign, they turn away and say, “Just a customary magic!”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: And if they see an Ayah, they turn away and say: "This is magic, Mustamir."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: And if they see a miracle they turn aside and say: Transient magic.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: Yet if they see a sign they turn away, and they say 'A continuous sorcery!'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: And if they behold a portent they turn away and say: Prolonged illusion.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: Yet, when they see a sign they [who deny the truth] turn their backs and say, "The same old sorcery!"
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: And if they behold a sign, they turn away and say: "magic continous"
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: If they see a sign, they turn away, and say, ‘An incessant magic!’
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: But if they see a Sign, they turn away, and say, "This is (but) transient magic."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: And if they see a sign, they turn away, and say: "This is continuous magic."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: Yet if they see a sign (the unbelievers) turn their backs and say: 'This is but a continuation of sorcery'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: Yet whenever they see a miracle, they turn away, and say, “Continuous magic.”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: And if they see a miracle, they turn away and say, "Passing magic."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [54:2] And if they, the disbelievers among Quraysh, see a sign, a miracle of the Prophet (s), they turn away and say, this is: ‘A powerful sorcery!’ (mustamirr, ‘powerful’, derives from al-mirra, meaning ‘strength’; or it [mustamirr] means ‘incessant’).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (And if they behold a portent) like the splitting of the moon (they turn away) they deny the sign (and say:) this sign is nothing but (Prolonged illusion) which will vanish.
